text: Of course one can’t condone the (alleged) behaviour of Oxfam staff in Haiti and elsewhere. But I do wonder how hard it must be to sustain “civilised” values in a disaster zone. And overall I still respect those who go in to help out, where most of us wd not tread.
Haiti was disgusting. But @Oxfam has done superb work for 70+ years & I for one am not abandoning it now.

Priti Patel, the former secretary for international development, says Oxfam should be stripped of its government funding over the allegations it covered up a sex scandal involving aid workers. Is she right? https://t.co/vB7GK44PPM
Terrible and disturbing story which should have far-reaching repercussions... https://t.co/zS57q8115s

Oxfam CEO Mark Goldring: “The intensity and the ferocity of the attack makes you wonder, what did we do? We murdered babies in their cots? Certainly, the scale and the intensity of the attacks feels out of proportion to the level of culpability". Genuine quote.
The reality in the UK is that people from all aspects of life use sex workers. Are we guilty of a terrible double standard against the Oxfam staff? https://t.co/dDCrhQCLQD
So Labour finally issue a statement on Oxfam. They attack the Charity Commission and the Government. But not the organisation that was actually responsible for the abuse and cover-up.
Remember, just £30 a month will provide clean prostitutes for up to six aid workers. Even a fiver could help pay for a blow job. So please give what you can, very good, very long time. #Oxfam

International aid charity Oxfam has been accused of sexual misconduct and abuse both in their UK shops and their foreign disaster zones. Has this scandal put you off donating to them? https://t.co/5OvhAUaFqB

"This is appalling. It hurts me very deeply.

Our priority is to stand alongside the women who were abused, and to root out sexual misconduct from our organization and we are working on that."

Oxfam Internat'l Executive Director @Winnie_Byanyima responds: https://t.co/URzVmyftYE

Penny Lawrence resigns as Deputy Chief Executive of Oxfam saying she takes "full responsibility" for behaviour of staff in Chad & Haiti at the time when she was programme director https://t.co/oys0cwbdPW
As Oxfam ambassadors Minnie Driver and Desmond Tutu quit their roles amid the Haiti sex scandal, @simonpegg explains why he is sticking by the charity https://t.co/gyDSel88DE https://t.co/6sqOgMtucQ
Oxfam covered-up use of prostitutes by aid workers in earthquake torn Haiti. what on earth has happened to our once proud charities
Yes, the #oxfamscandal is terrible. But please don't let it be used to shut down the invaluable work that #Oxfam does around the world. Millions of people in desperate need would suffer as a result.

Our statement on Haiti and Chad. Let us be clear: their behavior was and still is totally unacceptable – an appalling mark against the high values we set for ourselves at Oxfam. https://t.co/odiDBHOU2J

All I can tell you about this awful revelation about Oxfam is that I am devastated.Devastated for the women who were used by people sent there to help them, devastated by the response of an organization that I have been raising awareness for since I was 9 years old #oxfamscandal
Oxfam covered up the use of prostitutes by senior aid workers in earthquake-hit Haiti https://t.co/cLITJcP8mo

After it was revealed that Oxfam staff hired prostitutes during Haiti's earthquake relief effort, the government is reviewing its relationship with the charity. Does this scandal make you reluctant to donate to charity? https://t.co/ilwkh1YIAX
87 incidents of sexual abuse recorded at Oxfam last year, 53 of them referred to police or other external authorities. 20 dismissals.

Is #Oxfam being punished for totally unacceptable behaviour by some of its staff in Haiti in 2011 and its own response to that - or is it really being punished for daring to attack the rich and powerful?

Our reaction to sexual misconduct story in Haiti: https://t.co/xPSISBal84

We hope we can rebuild our trust with our supporters who know, as we do, that the actions of a few do not represent all that Oxfam stands for.

We'd hurt & insult the world's poor if Oxfam's sex scandal was ignored but aid also needs defending. Crisis being exploited by those who don't care about Haitians but hate Britain's 0.7% aid & charities
Glastonbury 'will stand by Oxfam' after aid workers sex scandal https://t.co/psPwOJ1I1p

Tras el repugnante escándalo sexual que Oxfam silenció en Haití, nos enteramos que ocultó también otro idéntico en Chad. Si hubiese sido una ONG católica la jauría progre la habría lapidado. Como no lo es, silencio. Cuánta hipocresía...

.@mrjamesob I’m tempted to up my Oxfam contribution, not because I don’t find this situation disgusting, but because there are thousands of decent workers doing a bloody great job to help people who are desperate, and this story will, no doubt, result in people giving less.

La ONG Oxfam admite que varios de sus cooperantes contrataron a jóvenes prostitutas, incluso menores, para montar una orgía. Fueron invitadas a casas y hospedajes pagados por la organización tras el terremoto que destruyó Haití en 2010 https://t.co/Ng4c9BVwWc
